pageTwo.title: Matheus Olivieri
pageTwo.firstparagraph: Engineer by grad and developer by heart, I’ve been working in Australia’s IT industry for the past 5 years. Since the beggining of my journey as a developer, nearly 3 years ago, I’ve been working on personal projects. I’m naturally curious and confident that I can deliver a good code. I wish to continue to perpetually working on improving and learning new programming skills.
pageTwo.subtitle: When I’m not coding, you can find me...
pageTwo.secondparagraph: playing bass with my band, watching soccer or, as a good Brazilian, in a barbecue with family and friends. I love traveling and being outside getting to know new people, but I’m also a huge fan of Netflix & chill days.

pageThree.title: Toolbox
pageThree.pa: I am passionate about technology, software development, creating logic, developing effective code and 3 years ago I decided to focus on becoming a good programmer. Since then I've been studying and practising a lot, being ready for all challenges.
pageThree.pb: Today I continue to specialize in Typescript, React, React Native and NodeJs, always looking to follow best practices and processes.

history.a: E há 3 anos atrás eu decidi focar em me tornar um bom programador e inicie um projeto pessoal chamado Gullie, onde utilizei inicialmente Django para o backend e React para o frontend.
history.b: Como procuro sempre o aprendizado continuo, recentemente rescrevi toda a aplicação novamente, dessa vez utilizando NodeJS para o backend e uma mescla de React e Next para o frontend.
history.c: Procurei sempre valorizar a importancia de ter testes no meu codigo, aplicar CI/CD e tem um código limpo.
history.d: Hoje em dia a applicação Gullie está disponível e hospedada na AWS, e é meu parque de diversões, onde consigo aplicar novos conhecimentos e continuar me desenvolvendo.
history.e: Ao lado podemos ver as principais tecnologies que eu utilizei e utilizo atualmente.

gullieWeb.description: The Gullie application was created as the challenge to apply my skills and continuously grow. This full-stack application includes a complete backend, an admin panel for internal staff, a customer admin panel, and a front-end web app. Gullie Web is the front-end of this application where the end user can navigate through the menu and view its products and details.
gullieWeb.a: The Gullie application was created as the challenge to apply my skills and continuously grow.
gullieWeb.b: This full-stack application includes a complete backend, an admin panel for internal staff, a customer admin panel, and a front-end web app.
gullieWeb.c: Gullie Web is the front-end of this application where the end user can navigate through the menu and view its products and details.

gullieManager.description: You have seen before the front-end of Gullie. Now Gullie Manager is the customer admin panel where venue owners can easily manage the content displayed on the online menu, from the dishes and their add-ons, to configure completely different menus for different times of the day.
gullieManager.a: You have seen before the front-end of Gullie.
gullieManager.b: Now Gullie Manager is the customer admin panel where venue owners can easily manage the content displayed on the online menu, from the dishes and their add-ons, to configure completely different menus for different times of the day.

gullieAdmin.description: Continuing, we now have Gullie Admin as Gullie was built as a multi-tenanted platform, Gullie Admin is the admin panel where new organizations can be created, general settings are managed and users are created.

gullieAPI.description: To finalise, we have the backbone of everything, which is the Gullie API. A complete REST API, built in NodeJS, that uses Prisma.io and Postgres. This backend includes all APIs required to support the Gullie application and is fully deployed to AWS, including CI/CD pipelines to make development and test as smooth as possible.
gullieAPI.a: To finalise, we have the backbone of everything, which is the Gullie API.
gullieAPI.b: A complete REST API, built in NodeJS, that uses Prisma.io and Postgres.
gullieAPI.c: This backend includes all APIs required to support the Gullie application and is fully deployed to AWS, including CI/CD pipelines to make development and test as smooth as possible.
